title: David Hume Kennerly
subtitle: Four years ago today @NickKennerly entertained Syrian refugee kids at Za'atari Camp near the Syrian border. The place held close to 90,000 refugees and opened seven years ago to accommodate civilians fleeing the fighting. They loved Nick, and he was happy to bring them joy. pic.twitter.com/CEeFf11GXz

title: Felicity Gray
subtitle: Ibi on her book:  the “destructive consequences of democracies relying on institutional processes that are deaf to human needs”. Our government needs to *listen* to the needs of refugee migrants, and it just doesn’t. #auspolpic.twitter.com/6LkarLhYd8

title: Peter McMullin Centre on Statelessness
subtitle: Wonderful seminar today by @ibi2020 @MelbLawSchool as part of the #Migration, #Refugees & #Statelessness Seminar Series. Thanks to Ibi and to our partners @MSEI_UniMelb for another fantastic event.pic.twitter.com/SWlPfhp7jY

title: Ballarat Regional Multicultural Council
subtitle:
-- GIRL SPACE --

Girl Space is a free fortnightly program designed to meet the needs of young women in Ballarat aged 12-25.

The group is inclusive of all women and encourages newly arrived migrants and refugees, Indigenous, LGBTIQA+ and marginalised members to consider joining. pic.twitter.com/EB9kBtfCP1

title: The Agri Collective
subtitle: The family owners of Luv A Duck took a decision 6 yrs ago to resettle 6 Burmese refugees in Nhill & today they employ over 30 & many other families have moved there  great result for a regional Agribusiness family business Setting an example for others pic.twitter.com/2EGSKEu6X1
